title: Tanner Houston
text:
My name is Tanner Houston. I am a 2nd year Doctoral Student in the Health Policy (Management) program at Harvard Business School.
My research focuses on competitive strategy specific to the healthcare setting and is grounded in organization economics.
Check out the About Me section to learn more of my interest outside of academia!

title: About
text:
Tanner Houston is a doctoral student in Health Policy Management at Harvard Business School. He received his B.S. in Exercise Science - Pre Medicine at the University of Texas Arlington, while a member of the varsity baseball team. He then went on to receive his MBA with a concentration in Healthcare Management from Baylor University.
Prior to joining the Health Policy PhD program, he was an operations manager within HCAâ€™s Physician Service Group overseeing outpatient operations for multiple specialties including orthopedics, cardiology, and solid organ transplant.
His current research interest are in organizational learning, innovation of healthcare delivery, physician decision making, and measuring the performance of healthcare delivery systems.
Outside of Academia, he enjoys any and all sports, but on any given weekend you can find him watching every second of Formula 1 coverage (proud member of #TeamLH44) or playing disk golf. Some of his favorite books are Hyperion by Dan Simmons and The Gunslinger by Stephen King.
Originally from Mansfield, TX he moved to the Cambridge area with his wife and 5 pets (2 dogs, 2 cats, and a tortoise).
